casebody.data:
AARON RIPS, PROSECUTOR, v. ABRAHAM LEVITAN ET AL., RESPONDENTS. Decided March 11, 1926.

Before Justices Teenchard, Katzenbach and Lloyd.

For the prosecutor, G. Earl Brugler. For the respondents, Abraham Levitan. Per Curiam.

We see no reason to modify our judgment.

We think the costs should abide the event of the new trial. Both motions are accordingly denied.

No costs on these motions.
